meanings.sent2: The magazine featured a bylined story by a famous author.
meanings.sent3: The bylined journalist always delivers interesting news.
meanings.sent4: Her bylined work shines brightly among the others.
meanings.sent5: The bylined piece left a lasting impression on the readers.

meanings.sent1: The bylined reporter is known for her insightful articles.
meanings.sent2: The newspaper only publishes bylined stories.
meanings.sent3: The bylined writer never fails to capture the audience's attention.
meanings.sent4: His bylined contributions add value to the publication.
meanings.sent5: The bylined column is always eagerly anticipated by readers.

meanings.definition: To put one's name on a byline.
meanings.sent1: She always bylined her articles to receive proper credit.
meanings.sent2: The journalist bylined the investigative piece before submitting it.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly bylined his cat as the author of the funny story.
meanings.sent4: Bylining his work gives him a sense of accomplishment.
meanings.sent5: The author carefully bylined each chapter of the book.
